snippet: Surgeons faced life-changing decisions as patients arrived with gruesome leg trauma.
abstract: Boston trauma surgeons sought to reach consensus before deciding to amputate limbs in treating victims of bombings at Boston Marathon, procedure that was required for many; widespread leg trauma was result of bombs that seemed to deliver their most vicious blows within two feet off the ground.

byline.original: By GINA KOLATA, JERÉ LONGMAN and MARY PILON
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Surgeons faced life-changing decisions as patients arrived with gruesome leg trauma.

headline.seo: Physical Legacy of Bomb Blasts Could Be Cruel for Boston Marathon Victims
headline.main: Doctors Saved Lives, if Not Legs, in Boston
headline.print_headline: Saving Lives, if Not Legs, With No Time to Fret
